data.title: 73 Best Gifts for Men That Won’t Disappoint
data.meta_description: Impress him with one of our gifts for men—including a new pizza oven, some staples from Patagonia, or a splurge worthy massage gun.
data.text:
Guys are notoriously hard to shop for, so finding the perfect gifts for the men in your life can be a challenge. What do you buy for the dad who says he needs socks for the fifth year in a row? (Hint: definitely not the socks he’s been buying himself.) Or the brother with a splurge-laden wish list of expensive gadgets and watches? (Hint: neither of those things.) Or the husband who would be happy with no gift at all (or worse, a gift card)? (Hint: not nothing…also, can’t relate!)

The answer is a set of cozy Bombas socks. Or an Ooni gas-powered pizza oven. Or a stylish Shinola desk clock. Or any of the very covetable presents on this list, which we compiled specifically to please your pickiest, unhelpful-hint-giving (favorite) men. So, without further ado, we present to you the best gifts for men.

Shop Our Top Picks

Best for hikers: Snow Peak Gore-Tex Rain Cap

Best for gamers: Samsung 24" FreeSync Curved Monitor

Best for coffee drinkers: Atlas Coffee CLub Gift Subscription

Best for self-care enthusiasts: Theragun Prime

Best for aspiring chefs: Ooni Koda 12 Gas Powered Pizza Oven

Best bling: Mejuri Square Box Chain Bracelet

Best for travel: Lululemon 2-in-1 Travel Duffle Backpack 45L

Shop by section:

Accessories & apparel gifts

Home & kitchen gifts

Self-care & tech gifts

Accessories & Apparel

Quince Hunter Polarized Stainless Steel Sunglasses

Timeless in shape and chic in material, these sunglasses are an unexpected pop of style. Plus the stainless steel construction means these are super durable. Aside from looking good, they also work hard—these specs block 99% of reflecting light and 100% of UV light.

Bellroy Apex Slim Sleeve Leather Wallet

A black leather wallet is expected. But a slim indigo blue design? Just the right kind of surprise. Heat bonding keeps the silhouette slim, avoiding bulky stitching altogether. A strong magnetic closure keeps everything closed.

Rains Texel Wash Bag

Forget the Dopp kits of yesteryear; this waterproof tote will fit a ton of bathroom essentials. The best part? It folds out and has a hanger, meaning he can attach it to the shower curtain rod or a door handle for easy access.

Paul Smith Multicolor Pencil Cufflinks

Sometimes a quirky pair of cuff links is just the thing to take a tried-and-true suit to the next (refreshed) level. We love these tiny pencils and so would any teacher, writer, or fan of nostalgia in your life.

Carhartt Michigan Canvas Coat

The light blue hue of this classic jacket is perfect for the dude who is always showing up in outfits you find yourself google-ing later. Carhartt is a classic for a reason—the brand has nailed the balance between “lightweight and breathable” and “durable enough to qualify as a family heirloom.”

Snow Peak Gore-Tex Rain Cap

A fully waterproof hat is hard to come by—ask any hiker, cyclist, or Seattleite. This design from Japanese brand Snow Peak has a buckle strap for easy adjustment, a short brim for solid coverage and increased visibility, and there’s a matching pair of pants and jacket (hint, hint).

Quince Onyx Rectangular Ring

Some statement pieces come in small packages—like this 18k gold vermeil ring. It’s subtle enough to pair well with a T-shirt but can pull its own weight with a suit as well.

Lululemon 2-in-1 Travel Duffle Backpack 45L

Never underestimate the power of a really good duffel bag. This one seamlessly transforms into a backpack—a massive feature if the guy in your life is often on the go. It’s made with water-repellant fabric, tons of exterior and interior pocket space, a handy water bottle pouch, adjustable straps, and a sleek look that won’t drag their travel outfit down.

Small Travel Waterproof Carry-On Luggage

We love Rains for its absolute dedication to waterproof design. Weighing in at seven pounds in an this wheeled carry-on bag has a ton of pockets and space for packing all the essentials.

Men's Mountain Classic Quilted Ankle Boots

Indoor slippers are one thing, but backyard slippers? There’s a concept. Sometimes you just have to hop outside for a second. A supportive footbed paired with fleece lining and a non-slip rubber sole makes these a powerhouse without skimping on maximum loungewear-level comfort.

Mejuri Square Box Chain Bracelet

Available in sterling silver or 14k gold, this simple bracelet is the perfect accessory for any outfit.

Monogrammed Travel Watch Roll

If they can’t be seen without their favorite watch (or second-favorite, or third-favorite) fastened around their wrist, upgrade their travel accessory situation with this personalized gift. Made of durable polyurethane exterior and a soft microsuede interior (no scratches here!), there’s enough room for three watches inside.

Quince Mongolian Cashmere Ribbed Beanie

Crafted with Mongolian cashmere, this super soft ribbed beanie is a wintertime staple (we think it would pair perfectly with the brand’s cashmere hoodie). Your man can rock it throughout the winter.

Vintage Thermal Henley

While sweats will always have their place in a loungewear collection, we’re all about the henleys for cooler temps. Made of woven cotton and available in five rich colors, this tee plays well as a layer or on its own with a pair of jeans. He’ll love the versatility, which is a gift in itself.

Nike Men's Therma-FIT Versatile Pants

Comfort is the ultimate gift, and these joggers—which are made of a sustainable polyester and come in four colors—will put a smile on their face. Just make sure they toss those old gray sweatpants in return.

Green & Off-White Stripe Scarf

A luxe scarf is one of those things we’ll always want but won’t necessarily buy for ourselves. But unwrapping a present and seeing the peek of wool and fringe? You won’t find many people who wouldn’t be delighted to open up a stylish scarf. This design from Acne Studios is the perfect pop of color for any look.

Eberjey William Tencel Modal Long PJ Set

Again, pajamas and loungewear are always a treat—especially when they’re insanely soft like this sustainable Tencel Modal Eberjey set. The matching button-down top and pull-on bottoms feature white piping for a classic look.

Bombas Men's Merino Wool Blend Quarter Socks

One serious pop of color paired with a tried-and-true neutral—this is what a gift set of socks should be. Made of a super comfortable merino wool blend, they’ll feel like they’re walking on clouds all day long. We’ll stand behind it: Socks make for the best gift, no matter the celebration.

The North Face Thermoball Traction Mule V Mens Slippers

He’ll think of you every time he slides into these rubber-sole slippers (which will be often).

On Running Cloud 5 Sneakers

The lightest-weight sneaker imaginable, On Cloud 5s are engineered for an active lifestyle. Your sporty dude can wear them all day long, from the gym to the streets.

Alex Mill Garment Dyed Work Jacket

For your favorite fashionisto, this timeless work jacket from New York–based Alex Mill is a great gift idea that can be dressed up or down. The sturdy recycled denim fabric is peppered with flecks of natural cotton for an artisan texture.

Arc'teryx Atom Insulated Jacket

Here’s a lightweight windbreaker that’s an ideal get for just about anyone on your list—from the guy who likes to jog in subzero temperatures to the jetsetter who always needs more room in his carry-on.

Coachwhip Carabiner

The beauty of this sleek carabiner from Craighill is that there’s multiple ways he can use it—to clip his keys to his jeans, his water bottle to his hiking sack, or his wireless headphones to any work bag.

Arlo Skye X Dusen Dusen Bag

From Arlo Skye and Dusen Dusen, here’s a thoughtful gift idea for someone who needs a new weekender that can double as a gym bag.

MOFT Flash Wallet and Stand

Some people don’t love bulky phone cases with PopSockets and other gadgets…. But they still want a better grip and a spot to store often-used cards. This wallet doubles as a magnetic stand, meaning they can flip their phone into viewing mode in an instant.

Patagonia Synchilla Fleece Gloves

If his favorite T-shirts and pullovers come from Patagonia, these gloves in the brand’s warm Synchilla recycled fleece material will likely be a winner.

Home & Kitchen

Atlas Coffee Club Gift Subscription

This gift subscription from Atlas Coffee Company will supply him with three-to-twelve months of the best beans around. You'll be able to select when shipments start and each delivery postcards and tasting notes.

Five Two Barware Essentials Set

Maybe he’s been dropping hints about a new cocktail-making hobby—or maybe you’d love for someone else to make the drinks every once in a while. Whatever it may be, this set of wine markers, a magnetic felt drip catcher, brass bottle stoppers, wine bottle tote, felt coasters, and bottle opener is a more subtle nudge.

Bodum Chunky Wine Glasses

Sometimes all a hangout needs is a pair of cute, chunky wine glasses. In fact, there are few situations inappropriate for said drinking vessels. We love that they’re dishwasher-safe and colorful without going overboard—you won’t need to think twice about whether or not they will fit in with the rest of their dinnerware.

Houseplant Green Ridge Ashtray

Smoking accessories don’t get more luxe than the designs coming from Houseplant. This particular ashtray’s shape is inspired by a salty snack—who knew ridges could provide such a picturesque holding spot for a cigarette or joint?

Braun Classic Analogue Wall Clock

We all have that friend who is constantly late. This wall clock probably won’t help that cause, but its slight utilitarian vibe makes it a designer-level addition to any room.

Saltverk Salt Cellar

There are some things you look at, lust over, and never buy for yourself because why opt for a $50 version when the $5 design you have at home works just fine? This is where gifting becomes such a beautiful thing. This salt cellar was a collaboration between Icelandic design team Hugdetta and a group of artists in Sierra Leone. The glazing on the vessel feels slightly Icelandic, which is entirely fitting.

Make Your Own Hot Sauce Kit

It seems like there are only two sides to the hot sauce spectrum: You either love it—like “can’t get enough heat” kind of obsession—or you avoid it at all costs. For the former, this set will let them tweak that liquid gold within an inch of the preference.

Ember Temperature Control Smart Mug

No one likes lukewarm coffee. In lieu of a boring water bottle, keep your man’s java piping hot with this temperature control smart mug that you can operate with a smartphone. And thanks to Amazon’s speedy shipping, we think it would make an especially nice last-minute gift.

Ooni Koda 12 Gas Powered Pizza Oven

It’s not a car, but your brother will feel like he’s on Top Chef with this gas-powered pizza oven that reaches an impressive 950 degrees in 15 minutes and cooks a 12-inch pie in just 60 seconds.

Corkcicle Chillsner Two-Pack

Beer bottles, on the other hand, are best kept chilled with Corkcicle’s Chillsner, an icy stick that you pop in the freezer (and a best seller from our Father’s Day gift guide). Paired with a few nice beer glasses, this two-pack is a unique gift that ensures your beer lover will never sip warm brew again.

Ash Boy Smells Candle | 50 Hour Long Burn

There aren’t many spaces that can’t be bettered with a candle. This scent from Boy Smells has touches of black coals, juniper berries, and smoke. It’s moody, it’s a little bit sexy, and it’s got a 50-hour burn—the perfect option for a nice valentine's day gift.

Weber Small Stainless Steel Vegetable Basket

For the BBQ pitmaster who has everything, this small vegetable basket will always be appreciated. It helps keep veggies fresh and grill-mark-free while delivering all the flavor a grill has to offer.

Whiskey Peaks Half Dome Decanter

Inspired by Yosemite National Park’s Half Dome peak, this spirits decanter is a hiker’s dream. It’s unbelievably made from hand-blown glass, so slight variations are to be expected.

Butcher's Choice Box

This gift box from Porter Road is a griller’s delight. The handpicked curation includes a selection of dry aged steaks, sirloin filets, pork chops, dry aged ground beef, a pound of pork bacon, plus a seasonal item that changes each month.

Brightland Mini Essentials

With high-quality olive oils and vinegars, a little bit goes a long way. That’s why this sampler set of Brightland’s four essential bottles is the ideal gift for any aspiring cook or foodie dude.

Breville Barista Express Espresso Machine

Make your coffee lover into a barista with this user-friendly Breville espresso machine. Thanks to the integrated grinder, it’s a one-stop-shop for cappuccinos, macchiatos, and all the other delicious third-wave coffee drinks out there.

Hot Ones Hot Sauce 10 Pack

Test their heat tolerance with a set of hot sauces from the very same crew that’s responsible for Hot Ones. This pack of 10 bottles is inspired by season 23 of the show, so they can go head to head with celebrities like Barry Keoghan, Shakira, and Ice Spice.

New York Times Custom Football Book

Football fans will love an anthology on their favorite team. These books gather printed coverage from The New York Times to create a history of some of the most popular football teams in the country.

Mercado Famous Holy Jamon

Mercado Famous’s Jamón sampler is a great gift idea for your fave foodie. Each set comes with all three of the brand’s tasty packs sourced from Spain and ready to eat.

Do Your Whiskey Make Your Own Whiskey Kit

This creative DIY whiskey kit includes three types of oak and six herbs and spices so your dude can blend his own whiskey mix. Though if you’re looking to go above and beyond, we recommend also checking out this personalized barrel from Uncommon Goods.

YETI Colster Can Insulator

Never let your man’s beer (or seltzer!) get warm with Yeti’s sleek can insulator that maintains the liquid’s straight-out-of-the-cooler temperature even on the hottest of summer days. A matching keychain and a pack of his favorite brew should elevate the surprise.

9 in 1 Multitool Pen

This nine-in-one multitool pen can do it all. Phone holder? Check. Flashlight? Check. Ruler? Check. Bottle opener when happy hour rolls around? Double check.

Material Trio of Knives

Another kitchen must-have, this trio of knives is made of cryogenically-tempered Japanese stainless steel and high carbon, with stain-resistant composite handles. With these three in his arsenal, your dude can whip up anything.

Shinola Runwell Desk Clock

Even better than wrist candy, this chrome-and-black Shinola desk clock is perfect for your watch collector brother. Plus, the handsome timepiece is accompanied by a convenient wooden stand.

Self-care & tech gifts

24" FreeSync Curved Monitor

There’s a lot of tech out there that can help gamers feel like they’re, you know, actually in the game they’re playing. A curved monitor is one of those tools—this one, in particular, is designed to provide a hi-res panoramic view. Samsung also used a nifty little thing called Active Crystal Color technology, which helps provide a more vivid display for seeing well in the dark of night or bright light of day.

Therabody Pink Theragun mini Hand-Held Massager

If he works out and travels a lot, this tiny muscle massager will become his best friend on the road. It may be small in size, but this Theragun packs a ton of power into its three foam attachments. Plus its Bluetooth capability means you can connect it to the Theragun app for personalized use recommendations.

Fischersund No.23 Fragrance

Everyone likes to smell good, but not all who wear a scent get stopped in the middle of a grocery store aisle to be asked about said fragrance. There’s a good chance that will happen with this Iceland’s brand’s debut scent. With touches of anise seed, black pepper, tobacco seeds, and Icelandic Sitka spruce, it’s certainly unique.

Okuhida Onsen Yunohana Onsen Powder

Prepare to transform their bathtub into a sauna-level sanctuary with these all-natural mixes of minerals sourced from the northern Japanese Alps. The unscented powder turns the bath into a milky white soak, helping relieve the body of stress and tension.

Brooklinen Weighted Throw Blanket

Sometimes the cure for a bad day is diving right under a weighted blanket and staying put for an hour or three. Clocking in at 12 pounds, this breathable throw is light enough to nap under without having claustrophobic nightmares.

Samsung Jet™ Pet Cordless Stick Vacuum

Any pet owner would be delighted to receive such a powerhouse of a machine. At six pounds, it’s a lightweight design that will slide right under couches and into the toughest-to-reach corners for a full clean.

Apple AirTag 4 Pack

We all lose things; there’s no getting around that. But have them slap an AirTag on that thing they keep misplacing—keys, phone, headphones, shame (just kidding on that last one, we can’t help there)—and it’ll instantly lower their stress levels.

Newport Set

We all have that person who is constantly trying out whatever the latest trend in sports may be. Feed that habit with a set that delivers everything they’ll need for impromptu games of pickleball. The paddle is made with a lightweight (and durable!) fiberglass and the sanded texture means they can perfect their spin shot.

Bose QuietComfort 35 II Wireless Bluetooth Headphones

Techies will never refuse an upgrade to their headphones. When it comes to tech gifts, there are lots of audio options out there, but these over-ear ones from Bose offer world-class noise cancellation, Bluetooth pairing they won’t have to fight to actually use, and a noise-rejecting microphone system. It’s a whole lot of power in a beautiful package. Go forth and skip the Apple Watch in favor of something a bit different.

Create Your Own Reel Viewer

For an old-school gift, consider going with a toy that speaks to their sentimental side. This reel viewer can be customized with your own set of photos, meaning it’s a great pick for any occasion. Some ideas: photos from the all-American road trip you took together, wedding snapshots, or a few beloved family photos. Whatever it is, they’ll love taking this stroll down memory lane.

Hatch Restore 2 Bedside Light, Sound Machine & Sunrise Alarm Clock

Getting up is hard and anyone who says otherwise is (probably) lying a little bit. The Hatch lamp helps make it a little easier, probably because it’s a full-fledged wake-up machine in one tiny package. Not only can the user set the traditional alarm, but there’s a time-activated light “alarm” that makes it feel like a little sliver of the sun has slipped right into the room. To round things out, the sound machine is great for lulling people to sleep.

Loftie Alarm Clock

Waking up is slightly easier when you have an alarm clock that houses meditations, breath work circuits, Bluetooth speaker capabilities, and a gentle two-step system for jostling someone out of sleep. This is that alarm clock.

Braun Series 9 9370cc Rechargeable Wet & Dry Men's Electric Shaver

This swanky trimmer to replace his disposable razor is an investment in the long run. It has its own charger station, plus five shaving elements to deliver a close and comfortable shave that gets more hair in one stroke than any other shaver.

Jack Black Skin Saviors Kit

Get your guy on the skin care train with luxurious products he can’t resist. This all-in-one Jack Black kit is available at Nordstrom and Sephora and has everything he’ll need for a fresh face— from facial cleanser and energizing scrub to SPF-equipped moisturizer and lip balm.

Apple AirPods Pro with MagSafe Charging Case

If your dad is still listening to podcasts with wired headphones, Apple AirPods are a sure-fire gift choice that he can pair perfectly with his iPhone via Bluetooth. Not only are these earbuds wireless, but they also boast noise-cancellation technology for an immersive music experience.

Kitchen Confidential

Feed his addiction to The Bear and No Reservations reruns with a relevant read. This copy of Kitchen Confidential from Anthony Bourdain should do the trick.

Sonos Roam

Minimalist, compact, and rechargeable, this portable waterproof smart bluetooth speaker is chic enough to display at home, yet also small enough to bring along just about anywhere.

Getaway

If he’s a nature buff, a weekend trip courtesy of Getaway is a gift the both of you can enjoy. With cabins located nationwide and stays starting at $109 per night (pending location, seasonality, and availability), a picturesque vacation is just a few clicks away.

Lomi 1 Electric Kitchen Food Recycler

Say he got really into meal-prepping…. And then it was bread-making. From there, it could have been a kitchen herb garden. No matter where the path started, it usually leads to composting or food recycling. This smart appliance takes food scraps and turns them into natural fertilizer in 24 hours. You know, for the herb garden.
